content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: DOMAIN
      operator: is_not_contained_by
      value:
        - CT.DOMAIN
    - name: Variable
      operator: is_not_contained_by
      value:
        - STUDYID
        - DOMAIN
        - USUBJID
        - POOLID
        - SPDEVID
        - VISIT
        - VISITNUM
        - VISITDY
        - ELEMENT
        - TAETORD
        - EPOCH
    - name: Variable
      operator: prefix_matches_regex
      prefix: 2
      value: DOMAIN
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0349
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Trigger error when prefixed variable within custom domain does not match
  the DOMAIN value
Outcome:
  Message: Prefixed variable within custom domain does not match the DOMAIN value
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Variable
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0349
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: 'The following variables are exceptions to the philosophy
                  that all variable names are prefixed with the Domain Identifier:
                  -Required Identifiers (STUDYID, DOMAIN, USUBJID) -Commonly used
                  grouping and merge Keys (e.g., VISIT, VISITNUM, VISITDY) All Demographics
                  domain (DM) variables other than DMDTC and DMDY -All variables in
                  RELREC and SUPPQUAL, and some variables in Comments and Trial Design
                  datasets. Required Identifiers are not prefixed because they are
                  usually used as keys when merging/joining observations. The --SEQ
                  and the optional Identifiers --GRPID and --REFID are prefixed because
                  they may be used as keys when relating observations across domains.'
                Document: IG v3.4
                Item:
                Section: 4.2.2
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - FINDINGS
      - INTERVENTIONS
      - EVENTS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: Trigger error when prefixed variable within custom domain does not match the DOMAIN value

Outcome.Message: Prefixed variable within custom domain does not match the DOMAIN value

Citations.Cited_Guidance: The following variables are exceptions to the philosophy that all variable names are prefixed with the Domain Identifier: -Required Identifiers (STUDYID, DOMAIN, USUBJID) -Commonly used grouping and merge Keys (e.g., VISIT, VISITNUM, VISITDY) All Demographics domain (DM) variables other than DMDTC and DMDY -All variables in RELREC and SUPPQUAL, and some variables in Comments and Trial Design datasets. Required Identifiers are not prefixed because they are usually used as keys when merging/joining observations. The --SEQ and the optional Identifiers --GRPID and --REFID are prefixed because they may be used as keys when relating observations across domains.
